item.title: Is this command correct?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“lmfaoown, post:3, topic:264727”]symbol: method checkLog(java.lang.String)
location: class client
if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && (checkLog(“donaters”))) {
^

Any idea’s?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 26, 2009, 08:44:39 pm[/size][hr]symbol: method checkLog(java.lang.String)
location: class client
if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && (checkLog(“donaters”))) {
^

If you cant read where its under :P[/quote]

“checkLog” is not declared or initialized.

[quote=“anc13ntpk3r, post:4, topic:264727”]if (command.startsWith("yell") && (checkLog("donaters")) { String text = command.substring(5); yell("[DONOR] "+playerName+" says" + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1).toLowerCase()); }

try that[/quote]

The parenthesis use on that is incorect.

item.title: Is this command correct?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

You needed a few fixes with parenthesis, That’s about it.

if (command.startsWith("yell") && (checkLog("donaters"))) { // Redid parenthesis count.
    String text = command.substring(5);
    yell("[DONOR] "+playerName+" says" + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + 
    text.substring(1).toLowerCase());
}

Read full topic

item.title: Is this command correct?
item.dc:creator: @lmfaoown lmfaoown
item.description:
@lmfaoown wrote:

Can someone help me with this command?

if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && (checkLog(“donaters”) {
String text = command.substring(5);
yell("[DONOR] “+playerName+” says" + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1).toLowerCase());
}

Im not sure how its suppose to come out. i think it was like that but… no. anyone know? Thanks!

Read full topic
